DOC.brief_title: Soy-Based Meal Replacement Helping Women With Stage I , Stage II , Stage III Breast Cancer Complete Remission Lose Weight
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine ability recruit survivor estrogen receptor/progesterone receptor ( ER/PR ) -negative stage I-III breast cancer participate 3-month , soy-based , meal-replacement ( Almased® ) weight loss intervention . - Assess patient 's ability adhere intervention protocol . - Measure change anthropometrics ( body weight , bioelectrical impedance , waist circumference ) biomarkers ( serum level glucose , insulin , highly specific C-reactive protein , insulin-like growth factor , insulin-like growth factor bind protein-3 , lipid ) . - Measure change health-related quality life . OUTLINE : This prospective , longitudinal , pilot study . Patients undergo goal-oriented , cognitive-behavioral therapy comprise group counsel weekly 3 week individual counsel month . Weight loss intervention include behavioral technique , dietary modification ( use portion-controlled diet soy-based meal-replacement [ Almased® ] twice daily ) , physical activity ( ≥ 15 minute per day , 6 day week ) , social support . Weight loss monitor weekly patient complete daily log dietary intake physical activity . Therapy continue 12 week . Health-related quality life assess baseline weekly 12 week . Patients undergo blood draw baseline 12 week analysis C-reactive protein , glucose , insulin , insulin-like growth factor ( ILGF ) , ILGF-binding protein-3 . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 25 patient accrue study .
